Let P(x) be the statement "x is a prime number" and Q(x) be the statement "x is an odd number". Write the negation of the statement "Every prime number is odd" in predicate logic notation, and then determine whether it is true or false:

Negation: There exists a prime number x such that not Q(x), i.e., "There exists a prime number that is not odd" or ∃x(P(x) ∧ ¬Q(x)).

Determining truth value: The negation is false since every prime number is indeed odd.
